habitat_description:
This species of salamander occurs in forested watersheds of north-central Idaho from the Coeur d’Alene River to the Salmon River (Nussbaum et al. 1983). Two other locations exist in extreme western Montana (Reichel and Flath 1995). Areas occupied by this species includes several headwater streams south of Deborgia and Saltese in Montana (Green et al. 2013). Habitat includes streams and streamside habitats within moist forests (Stebbins 2003). Breeding habitat consists of secretive nest chambers beneath stones, logs, and crevices in small streams (Nussbaum et al. 1983). Cover used by adults is similar to breeding habitat and little is known about adults due to rarity of encounters (Nussbaum et al. 1983). 

Cover is provided by stones, logs, and crevices in small streams (Nussbaum et al. 1983).
